title: 110_s2086
content: The "SCHIP Extension Act of 2007" extends the State Children's Health Insurance Program (SCHIP) funding for fiscal year 2008 and the first 6 months of fiscal year 2009. The amendment allocates $5,000,000,000 for fiscal year 2008 and $2,500,000,000 for the first 6 months of fiscal year 2009. Additionally, it increases funding to $40,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2007 and 2008, and $20,000,000 for the first 6 months of fiscal year 2009. SEC. 3. ADDITIONAL ALLOTMENTS TO ADDRESS SCHIP FUNDING SHORTFALLS FOR FISCAL YEAR 2008 AND FIRST 6 MONTHS OF FISCAL YEAR 2009. Section 2104 of the Social Security Act is amended to address SCHIP funding shortfalls for Fiscal Year 2008 and the first 6 months of Fiscal Year 2009 by allotting amounts to eliminate estimated shortfalls for approved State child health plans. The Secretary estimates that projected Federal expenditures for approved State child health plans will exceed the sum of the State's previous unexpended allotments, current allotment, and any redistributed amounts during the shortfall period. The proration rule applies if the amount available for a shortfall period is less than the estimated shortfalls. Appropriation and allotment authority are provided for additional allotments to shortfall States. For fiscal year 2008, up to $1,500,000,000 is appropriated for the shortfall period. For the shortfall period in fiscal year 2009, up to $1,100,000,000 is appropriated from Treasury funds. Option for qualifying states to receive enhanced SCHIP matching rate for Medicaid coverage of certain children. Option for qualifying states to receive enhanced SCHIP matching rate for certain Medicaid expenditures, allowing them to elect to be paid an additional amount each quarter from their allotment under section 2104 starting from fiscal year 2008. The qualifying states have the option to receive an enhanced SCHIP matching rate for certain Medicaid expenditures by electing to be paid an additional amount each quarter from their allotment under section 2104 starting from fiscal year 2008. This additional amount is equal to what would have been paid to the State under title XIX if the enhanced FMAP had been substituted for the Federal medical assistance percentage. Expenditures must be made after the enactment of this provision and during the period when funds are available to the qualifying State for medical assistance to eligible individuals. Eligible individuals for medical assistance under the State plan or waiver, aged under 19, with family income above 133% of the poverty line but below Medicaid applicable income level.
